titleInfo.title: 3rd Platoon, Company A of the 109th Engineers Combat Battalion After African Campaign

mods.abstract: The 109th Engineer Regiment was organized as a South Dakota National Guard unit in 1924. It was called up for federal service on February 10, 1941 and trained in Louisiana before being sent to Camp Killadeas, Ireland in preparation for the invasion of North Africa. The 109th was among the first units to land in Algiers in November of 1942 and eventually fought in the Italian theater as well. The unit was deactivated after V-E Day but called up again in 1950 for further service in Germany. Most of the unit had returned home by 1952, where it resumed its duties with the National Guard. The 109th also served in Iraq before the unit was formally deactivated in Sturgis, South Dakota on August 18, 2007.

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections
